Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations

incorporation_agency: Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations and Charitable Organizations
charitable_registration_agency: Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations and Charitable Organizations
exemption_threshold_note: Organizations with contributions under $25,000 annually that do not use professional fundraisers may be exempt from registration. Religious organizations and certain others are also exempt.

formation_requirements.certificate_of_formation: Articles of Incorporation - Nonprofit Corporation (Form DSCB:15-5306/7102)
formation_requirements.filing_agency: Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations
formation_requirements.notes: Pennsylvania does not require a registered agent but requires a registered office address in Pennsylvania. Nonprofit corporations can be formed as public benefit, mutual benefit, or religious corporations.

requirements.filing_agency: Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations and Charitable Organizations
requirements.due_date_specifics: Due every 10 years during anniversary month of incorporation
required_information: Names and addresses of current officers and directors
requirements.notes: Unlike most states, Pennsylvania requires corporate reports only every 10 years, not annually. However, charitable organizations must still file annual financial reports with Bureau of Charitable Organizations.

requirements.filing_agency: Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations and Charitable Organizations
requirements.form_number: Form BCO-10 - Charitable Organization Registration Statement
required_information: Copy of Articles of Incorporation or equivalent organizing document
List of officers, directors, and trustees with addresses
Financial statements for most recent fiscal year
requirements.notes: Registration is required before soliciting in Pennsylvania. Small organizations (<$25,000 contributions without professional fundraiser) are exempt but may voluntarily register.

requirements.filing_agency: Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations and Charitable Organizations
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 135 days (4.5 months) after fiscal year end
required_information: Updated list of officers and directors
requirements.notes: Registration fee schedule based on contributions: $0-$25k: exempt; $25k-$100k: $0; $100k-$250k: $50; $250k-$1M: $100; $1M-$5M: $150; $5M-$10M: $200; >$10M: $250.

requirements.due_date_specifics: Obtain after receiving IRS 501(c)(3) determination letter
requirements.form_number: Form REV-1715 - PA Nonprofit Sales and Use Tax Exemption
required_information: Copy of Pennsylvania incorporation or registration documents
requirements.notes: Once approved, exemption certificate does not expire. Exemption applies to purchases made for the organization's direct use in charitable activities. Not all purchases are exempt - review specific exemptions.

requirements.filing_agency: County Assessment Office and Court of Common Pleas
requirements.due_date_specifics: File before tax bills are issued for the year
requirements.form_number: Varies by county - Petition for Exemption
required_information: Description of property use for charitable purposes
Evidence of charitable activities benefiting the general public
requirements.notes: Pennsylvania property tax exemption requires: (1) nonprofit ownership, (2) actual use for charitable purposes, (3) benefiting indefinite number of persons (general public), (4) gratuitous service, (5) legitimate charitable purpose. Must meet all five criteria. Some counties require court approval.

requirements.due_date_specifics: License valid for calendar year; must renew annually
requirements.form_number: Small Games of Chance License Application
required_information: Proof of incorporation or registration in Pennsylvania
Description of games to be conducted
requirements.notes: Pennsylvania allows small games of chance (raffles, daily drawings, weekly drawings, bazaars, bingo) for qualified nonprofits existing 1+ year. Annual prize limit per game varies. Proceeds must benefit charitable purposes.

required_information: Current Small Games of Chance License
requirements.notes: Required for raffles with prizes exceeding $1,000 per chance. Limited to one special raffle per license year. Maximum prize $100,000. Organization must have Small Games of Chance license.

requirements.filing_agency: Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations and Charitable Organizations
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
required_information: List of officers and persons with management responsibility
requirements.notes: Required for paid professional fundraisers who solicit on behalf of charities. Each contract with a charity must be filed (Form BCO-11) before solicitation begins. Bond must be maintained throughout registration.

requirements.filing_agency: Pennsylvania Department of State - Bureau of Corporations and Charitable Organizations
requirements.due_date_specifics: Renewed annually from initial registration date
required_information: List of officers and management personnel
requirements.notes: Fundraising counsel provides consulting services but does not solicit or handle contributions. No bond required. Each contract must be filed before providing services.

requirements.filing_agency: Internal requirement - filed with board and included in BCO-10 filing
requirements.due_date_specifics: Within 135 days after fiscal year end (completed before BCO-10 due date)
requirements.notes: Pennsylvania requires audited financial statements for organizations with gross contributions over $300,000. Organizations under $300,000 may file internally prepared financial statements. Audit must be performed by independent CPA.

special_notes.decennial_filing: Pennsylvania is unique in requiring corporate reports only every 10 years (Decennial Report). However, charitable organizations must still file annual financial reports with the Bureau of Charitable Organizations.
special_notes.registration_fee_schedule: Annual charitable registration fees are based on contribution levels, ranging from $0 (for organizations under $100K) to $250 (for organizations over $10M).
special_notes.board_requirements: Pennsylvania nonprofit corporations must have at least three directors. Directors need not be Pennsylvania residents but must act in good faith and in the organization's best interest.
special_notes.five_part_test: Pennsylvania uses a strict five-part test for property tax exemption: (1) nonprofit ownership, (2) charitable use, (3) benefits general public, (4) gratuitous service, (5) legitimate purpose. All five must be satisfied.
special_notes.professional_fundraiser_contracts: All contracts with professional solicitors or fundraising counsel must be filed with the Bureau before solicitation begins using Form BCO-11. This is in addition to the fundraiser's own registration.
special_notes.political_activity_limits: 501(c)(3) organizations must comply with federal restrictions on political campaign intervention and lobbying activities. Pennsylvania law reinforces these federal limits.
special_notes.small_games_of_chance: Pennsylvania allows various small games of chance for nonprofits, but regulations are complex. Prize limits, frequency limits, and reporting requirements apply. Consult county regulations.
special_notes.audit_threshold: Pennsylvania's audit threshold is $300,000 in gross contributions, lower than many states. Organizations should track contributions carefully to determine audit requirements.
special_notes.dissolution_requirements: Upon dissolution, assets must be distributed to organizations with similar charitable purposes or to government. Court approval may be required depending on circumstances.
special_notes.unrelated_business_income: Organizations with unrelated business income over $1,000 must file IRS Form 990-T and may owe Pennsylvania Corporate Net Income Tax on UBIT.
special_notes.professional_solicitor_disclosure: Professional solicitors must disclose certain information to prospective donors, including that they are paid solicitors and the charity's name and contact information.
special_notes.county_variations: Gaming licenses and property tax exemptions are administered at the county level with significant variations. Contact local officials for specific requirements.
